name: Firebird Chicken
author: Chef John
summary: Usually when I steal a dish from someone, I steal both the recipe and the name - but not this time. The original firebird chicken is actually a stir-fry dish, and quite a bit different from what you're seeing here. But I absolutely love the name and thought it would fit perfectly for this very simple, extremely spicy, and incredibly delicious dish. Serve with finely chopped fresh chives.
ingredients: 2 (8 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
directions: Combine garlic, habanero peppers, and salt in a mortar and pestle and crush into a fine paste
Add Sriracha and egg and whisk to combine
Pull or trim off the tenderloin from the breasts, and then slice each one in half lengthwise, cutting at a 45-degree angle to create two relatively equal pieces
Place all 6 strips of chicken on a plate and dust generously on all sides with rice flour, making sure they are completely covered
Pour over the pepper mixture and use tongs to make sure each piece of chicken is coated evenly with the mixture and that there are no dry spots
Wrap and marinate in the fridge for 2 to 12 hours
Heat oil in a nonstick pan over medium-high heat
Cook chicken until well browned, and no longer pink in the centers, about 3 minutes per side
